Device & SIM

SIM Card / eSIM

5 min read Glossary
Quick Definition

A SIM card (Subscriber Identity Module) is a small chip that stores your phone number and carrier information, connecting your phone to your mobile service. An eSIM is an embedded digital version built into your phone that can be programmed remotely without a physical card.

Deep Dive

How This Applies to Vouch Mobile

Vouch Mobile offers both physical SIM cards and eSIM activation. When you sign up, choose a free physical SIM shipped to your door or instant eSIM activation if your phone supports it (iPhone XS and later, most Android flagships from 2019+). Both options get you connected to AT&T's network quickly, with eSIM activation often completing in minutes.

Common Questions

Frequently Asked Questions About SIM Card / eSIM

A SIM card (Subscriber Identity Module) is a small chip that stores your phone number, carrier information, and security credentials. It connects your phone to your mobile service and authenticates you on the cellular network.

An eSIM (embedded SIM) is a digital SIM built into your phone that can be programmed remotely without a physical card. It allows instant carrier activation via QR code or app and can store multiple carrier profiles.

Yes, Vouch Mobile offers both physical SIM cards (free with free shipping) and instant eSIM activation. If your phone supports eSIM (iPhone XS or later, most 2019+ Android flagships), you can activate in minutes without waiting for mail.

Most modern phones use Nano SIM, the smallest size. Vouch Mobile provides 3-in-1 SIM cards that can be punched out to fit Nano, Micro, or Standard SIM slots, so you'll have the right size regardless of your phone.

Yes, if both phones are unlocked and compatible with the same carrier network. Simply move your SIM card to the new phone. For eSIM, you'll need to transfer your eSIM profile to the new device through your carrier.

Losing your SIM card doesn't mean you lose your phone number. Contact Vouch Mobile to get a replacement SIM card or activate an eSIM. Your number is associated with your account, not the physical card itself.
